result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:13 PM Defendant JOSEPH P. HOLSTEN in court.  Attorney Paul C Rohloff in court for JOSEPH P. HOLSTEN.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. State asks for $3000 signature bond with conditions on New case 22CF35. DE request the no contact to be imposed. Court advises them to contact the Victim witness office. Time limits waived. Other cases will track with PH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:42 PM Defendant JOSEPH P. HOLSTEN in court.  Attorney Paul C Rohloff in court for JOSEPH P. HOLSTEN.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with. Atty. Rohloff gives medical reason why DE was not in court on 8/31. Warrant has been vacated. Bond is reinstated.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Voluntary appearance on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Rohloff is unsure of DE's whereabouts. State asks for $750 bench warrant - in state only. So ordered.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:43 AM - Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH P. HOLSTEN in court.  Attorney Paul C Rohloff in court for JOSEPH P. HOLSTEN. Tracking along with Shawano cases.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
